pr_title: Review the Java File of the Build Command

timeline.message: Review the Build command Java file

timeline.bodyText: This is sorta wrong, even the previous message. The binary built by the build command is not necessarily executable in the sense that it doesn't have to have an entry point.
timeline.author: pubudu91
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -68,8 +68,8 @@
  *
  * @since 0.90
  */
-@CommandLine.Command(name = BUILD_COMMAND, description = "Ballerina build - Builds Ballerina module(s) and generates " +
-                                                         "executable outputs.")
+@CommandLine.Command(name = BUILD_COMMAND, description = "Ballerina build - Build Ballerina module(s) and generate " +
+                                                         "executable output.")

replies.bodyText: As per the offline discussion we had with Kishanthan, shall we mention in the help text of build that executables are produced only for modules containing an entry point?
replies.author: pubudu91

timeline.bodyText: "Writes" is correct in this context isn't it? This is basically saying "The build command writes the output..."
timeline.author: pubudu91

replies.bodyText:
We use "write" as a convention following the practice used in docs of similar communities like [1].
[1] https://golang.org/cmd/go/
replies.author: praneesha

timeline.bodyText: This should be "you", going by the convention we use
timeline.author: pubudu91
pubudu91
pubudu91

timeline.bodyText: You -> you, at the start only
timeline.author: pubudu91
pubudu91

timeline.bodyText: Not introduced by this PR, but I don't think we need these comments. Shall we remove them, @hemikak?
timeline.author: MaryamZi

replies.bodyText:
Added the comment as a single line;
// Check if the output flag is set when building all the modules.
replies.author: praneesha
